summary: The document is a confidential FBI record from the JFK Assassination Records Collection, detailing investigative efforts in Florida to locate and interview individuals such as Orlando Piedra and Roberto Fernandez Miranda. These efforts were aimed at gathering information on alleged training groups in the Florida Keys. The document references classified data shared with Assistant Attorney General J. Walter Yeagley and notes the lack of knowledge among contacted informants about the training groups. It also includes administrative details highlighting its sensitive nature.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It details FBI investigative activities in Florida, focusing on individuals like Orlando Piedra and Roberto Fernandez Miranda for information on alleged training groups.
The report is classified as 'Confidential', referencing classified data from the Department of the Army shared with Assistant Attorney General J. Walter Yeagley.
Various informants and sources were contacted, but none had knowledge of training groups in the Florida Keys.
The document includes administrative details on classification and restrictions, indicating its sensitive nature.
